value.title: Trump’s voice is still very much being heard
value.excerpt: Former President Donald Trump's influence is currently having a resurgence. Candidates he has endorsed are winning key GOP primaries. Candidates he had not endorsed are still swearing fealty to him. And he may soon get an important bullhorn back: The mute button placed on him by Twitter may be lifted.

value.title: Google adds support for 24 new languages to Translate
value.excerpt: Google is adding support for 24 new languages to its Translate tool, the company announced today during its I/O 2022 developer conference. Among the newly available languages are Sanskrit, Tsongae and Sorani Kurdish.

value.title: Create video subtitles with Amazon Transcribe using this no-code workflow
value.excerpt: Subtitle creation on video content poses challenges no matter how big or small the organization. To address those challenges, Amazon Transcribe has a helpful feature that enables subtitle creation directly within the service. There is no machine learning (ML) or code writing required to get started.

value.title: English Has Become the Language of Science
value.excerpt: Between 1980 and 1996, natural science publications in Russian fell from 10.8 to 2.1 percent. German dropped from 2.5 to 1.2 percent. But English rose from 74.6 to 90.7 percent. This surge in English publications did not come from American authors or other native speakers of English.

value.title: Clearview AI agrees to restrict US sales of facial recognition mostly to law enforcement
value.excerpt: Clearview AI, a controversial facial-recognition software company, agreed on Monday that it will not sell its software to most companies in the United States — a decision that will largely restrict its use to law-enforcement agencies in the country.
